basics.name: Suraksha Vinod
basics.label: PhD Student
basics.summary: PhD student in Bioinformatics and Genomics with a keen interest in personalized medicine and complex diseases

work.name: Georgia Institute of Technology
work.summary: Investigated the influence of ancestry and environment on polygenic scores across five diseasesin a diverse cohort of ~10,000 individuals, and aimed to understand the notion of weathering

work.name: M. D. Anderson Cancer Center
work.summary: Implemented machine learning models with over 35,000 features to predict the tumor-specific total mRNA expression (TmS) across cancer types and evaluated its clinical utility through survival analysis and GSEA.

work.name: Centre for Brain Research, Indian Institute of Science
work.summary: Executed genome wide association studies (GWAS) utilizing WGS data with emphasis on rare variant association in a cohort of over 2000 individuals, and developed an extensive, parallelised computational pipeline for the same.

work.name: Leucine Rich Bio Pvt Ltd
work.summary: Explored the implications of gut microbiome on Parkinson's Disease by carrying out Bioinformatics data analysis such as quality control and assembly on Galaxy. Maintained an extensive database of literature on the same.

education.area: Biotechnology (Minor in Computer Science and Engineering)

awards.title: Computational Biology Faculty Research Award
awards.summary: Competitive graduate research assistantship for M.S. Bioinformatics students at Georgia Tech. 2x recipient.

awards.title: Prof. M R Doreswamy Merit Scholarship Award Certificate
awards.summary: Awarded to students whose academic performance is in the top 20% of the department. 5x recipient.

awards.title: 1st Runners-up - Nutrathon 2022
awards.summary: Placed 2nd (i.e., 1st Runners-up) at the Nutrathon 2022 hackathon conducted by the Department of Biotechnology, PES University.

awards.title: 2nd Runners-up - Druggathon 2021
awards.summary: Placed 3rd (i.e., 2nd Runners-up) at the Druggathon 2021 hackathon conducted by the Department of Biotechnology, PES University.

awards.title: Best Paper Award
awards.awarder: School of Sciences at Jain (Deemed-to-be University)
awards.summary: “Identification of potential inhibitor against Nipah virus using In silico approach” was presented via a poster and won the Best Paper Award among the UG/PG students in the Health and Well-being category at I-SENTIENT, an international conference on Science and Technology for Socio-Economic and Environmental Sustainability hosted by the School of Sciences, Jain (Deemed-to-be) University.

awards.title: Distinction Award Certificate
awards.summary: Awarded to students who have secured an SGPA of 7.75 and above. 2x recipient.

publications.name: Machine learning models predict tumor-specific total mRNA expression associated with clinical outcomes across 14 cancer types
publications.publisher: Cancer Research (American Association for Cancer Research)

publications.name: Identifying anti-diabetic potential of alpha-amylase inhibitors in Ocimum basilicum using In vitro and In silico approaches
publications.publisher: Suranaree Journal of Science and Technology
